en.title: Kero Shapes
en.credits_detail:
Written By: David Dionisio
Music From: Kevin Macleod
en.prop_sides_pair_equal: Two pairs of sides are equal.
en.ellipse_desc:
· Has a center point.

· Roundness defined by two axis.
en.blob_desc: · Made up of curves defined by equations.
en.poly_desc: · Formed by three or more straight lines (sides) connected in a loop, points are plotted on a plane.
en.tri_desc:
· Formed by three straight lines connected in a loop.
· Points are plotted on a plane.
· Angles sum up to 180°.
en.quad_desc:
· Formed by four straight lines connected in a loop.
· Points are plotted on a plane.
· Angles sum up to 360°.
en.instruct_collect: Press and hold the shape to collect it.
en.instruct_category_drag: Press and drag the item towards the category, and release.
en.intro_0_1: In this game, you will be helping these fine capable frogs analyze a potentially habitable planet by identifying the shapes scattered across the land.
en.intro_0_2: When it comes to categorizing shapes, one must figure out the common attributes they share.
en.intro_1_0: Here are some primary categories and their attributes that differentiate them from each other.
en.intro_1_1: For now, we will be focusing on identifying polygons.
en.intro_2_0: Remember that a polygon is formed by three or more straight lines that are connected in a loop.
en.intro_3_0: Now let's go forth, and help these lads survey the land!
en.level_intro_0_0: The following types of shapes will come up. Be sure to remember them!
en.level_0_continue: Go ahead and collect the rest of the shapes! Remember to match them with the correct category.
en.level_intro_3_0: Now that we've covered some of the polygons, let's take a closer look at triangles.
en.level_intro_3_1: As a sub-category of polygons, triangles follow the same attribute of being formed by a number of straight lines connected in a loop. In this case, there are three.
en.level_intro_3_2: With that in mind, we can then further identify sub-categories under the triangle with additional attributes.
en.level_intro_3_3: For this level, we will be looking at different triangles based on their angle values. Be sure to remember them!
en.level_intro_4_0: Now that we've seen some triangles based on their angle values, let's take a look at the ones based on their side values.
en.level_intro_5_0: For this level, we will be categorizing triangles based on their angles, and side lengths. These triangles will have more than one category that fit their attributes.
en.level_intro_6_0: We'll now be looking at the next sub-category of polygons, the quadrilaterals.
en.level_intro_6_1: As the name suggests, it is four-sided.
en.level_intro_6_2: We'll be looking at three particular quadrilaterals that have two pairs of opposite sides that are parallel, and equal-length.
en.level_intro_6_3: Just like triangles, some quadrilaterals have more than one matching category. Keep that in mind!
en.level_intro_7_0: On this level, we'll be looking at some more interesting quadrilaterals. These ones have emphasis on opposite sides and angles.
en.level_intro_8_0: On this final level, many of the quads will match with a bunch of categories.
en.level_intro_8_1: One helpful tip is to look at these categories in a hierarchy. Going from top to bottom, each level shares attributes from everything above.
en.level_intro_8_2: For example, a square is also: a rectangle, a rhombus, a parallelogram, a trapezoid, and a kite.
en.level_intro_8_3: Now on to reviewing these categories once more!
en.end_0:
Congratulations!
You have successfully helped the spacefaring frogs survey the planet!
Based on the analysis of the shapes gathered, the planet is habitable!

Thank you for playing!
